page.title: 10FLEETWOOD PARK
page.content: There are two gardens in the park. The flower garden has displays of ornamental kale and variegated honeysuckle,- purple and lavender, yellow and biscuit, pink and cream and white and ivory. I enjoy reading when sitting in the rose garden where each bed has a single colour of rose,- one bed has all blue roses. They stretch out in a circular terrace from the monument like one enormous bouquet. The ornamental duck pond is fed by a little stream and protected by a wooden fence and bushes. Above the level of the pond is a small wood with picnic tables so that people can watch the 15 varieties of fowl, from marbled teal to mandarin ducks. There used to be fish but not now; some people find it amusing to destroy or vandalize the park. Many people find happiness in the park; we must keep caring for it.
